subject: Sales
title: Google Ads: Selling to Intent
description: A micro-lesson that makes Google Ads: Selling to Intent usable.

hook.text: Before Google, ads were guesses. Afterward, sellers could reach people at the exact moment they searched.

buildup.text: Pay-per-click meant sellers only paid when someone showed real interest by actually clicking.

discovery.text: Intent-based advertising flipped the model. Instead of interrupting people, you answered their questions.

twist.text: Bidding wars inflated costs fast. The promise of cheap targeted ads grew expensive sooner than expected.

climax.text: Google proved timing is everything. Reach people when they're actively searching and they convert.

punchline.text: Sell to someone already searching and you've won.

quiz.question: What made Google Ads revolutionary?
options: They targeted people at the exact moment of intent
